title: Home to the Annual Margaret River Surf Classic. Great viewing area.
text:
The Point has a good parking area, good change room facilities and landscaped viewing areas and lookouts where you get a great view of the beach and, of course, any surfing going on.

The Surf Classic has been held at this site since 1978. There are three different areas Main Break, Surfside and The Box.

I would not swim here though when there is a great beach at Gnarabup a short distance away.

title: Easy access
text: Beautiful beach with plenty of facilities and ample parking. Popular spot for sunset. Nearby Sea Garden restaurant worth a visit but it closes in the afternoon.

title: Best location to watch the wave
text: Went to this view point so many times during our stay in Margaret River. The view is awesome and there are many parking lots to just park and enjoy some lunch or even a drink. Its great to walk around as well and even head down to the beach.

title: Great view opf the Surf and Whale Watching
text: We were just at Surfers Point a couple of weeks ago.Luckily the sun was shinning and we had a great view of the ocean and were lucky enough to catch a glimpse of some whales in the distance.Lots of people there surfing(does anyone work midweek?) and the car park was quite full.We have been there before on a weekend and there is a coffee van there that makes a great cuppa.Probably the best part of the beach at Prevelly

title: Great Amenities for Surfers & Visitors
text: The overcast conditions, rain and winds were a bit of a damper. If I was to select a favourite beach area, this would probably be it although unlikely to ever get me on a beach nowadays. Great improvements over the years with grassed areas, walking tracks, parking and allied amenities to cater for surfers and visitors. A few brave, or foolhardy, surfers on the beach, boards in hand and contemplating the swells. Didn't see any of them venture into the water while we were there.

title: Awesome views, great spot.
text: Absolutely loved our time here, beautiful views, lots of surfers and even some seals. Love grassed areas to sit, clean toilets and lots of parking. Unfortunately a bit to cloudy for a good sunset but I bet it’s spectacular.

title: Surf
text:
We visited this beach area on a windy day but apparently that's how it always is.  It's very well organised with very good car parking, toilets and boardwalk and viewing areas for those who want to enjoy watching the surfers, sailboarders and the like.  Great to be able to avoid sand!

When we were there we saw sailboarders and kite surfers.  All very experienced judging by their skill levels.  The sea was certainly making them work.

Worth a visit.

title: Always windy always beautiful
text: Todays trip was our second time in 2 years at this location. Always fresh breeze and stunning beaches. Finally we got a time to catch up on some suntan. Chillax at its best

title: Absolute must see when at Margaret river region
text: We are not surfers but we always enjoy visiting prevelley surfers point every time we are in the area . About 10 minutes drive from Margaret river township , it has stunning views of the ocean . Its very well set up for families with barbecues, benches and stairs all the way to the beach . Dog friendly beach. Toilets and showers too. Great place to catch the sunset and go for long walks .

title: Stunning beach view with strong waves
text: Stunning beach view with strong waves. I was so amazed to see such a beautiful beach that is used for surfing competitions in Australia. I came in march 2020, thus the weather is a bit weird with little rains, cold strong wind, and most of time sunshine. But the view is simply breathtaking, nothing in my experience comes close to this.

title: Quintessential Beach Experience
text:
Home to Margaret River Pro competition and the international surfing circuit this beach has you covered. From parking to walking trails and from pavilions with picnic tables to grassy lawns, there’s room to enjoy a sunset, launch your board, or be a bystander. Popular among locals and visiting tourists this beach is on the top ten for Margaret River. 

Beware the Surfers Pro is a media circus.

title: Great place to chill and relax.
text: Nice cooling breeze on the beach. A great place to watch the surfers and wind surfers. Clean toilets at the car park, plus grassed areas to sit on if you don’t want to go on the beach.

title: A must do in Margaret River area
text: Fantastic view.  Lovely lawn. Great for the active or less active. Beautiful walk paths to River Mouth.

title: Margarets
text: Mate, if u want to watch the surfers in the morning, or kite surfers, and sailboarding in the arvo, this is it in Margaret River. Without to much ado, this is the el primo spot for surfing and surf watching. Enjoy

title: Sunset and surf watching
text: Nice place to enjoy the beautiful sunset and watch the experienced surfers in action. Probably wouldn’t bother with the heavily battered fish n chips from the on site van though.

title: Great at sunrise
text: Western Australian beaches are famed for the sunset over the ocean, however an early morning trip to watch the sunrise here showed a serene and alternative view of this picturesque location. A must see if in the region and worth exploring the rocks next to the point

title: Amazing views
text:
Amazing views from the place overlooking the ocean. 
Ample parking and also has viewing deck and steps even to go down to the beach.
Also an amazing cafe right on the beach which is another highlight

title: Wow
text: Visited on Tuesday 26th November. Wow what a great beach for the surfers and all those who what a great view of the coastline here. Plenty of parking spots and so close to Margaret River as well.

title: At The Mouth Of Margaret River
text: Located adjacent to the mouth of the Margaret River this is a pretty and interesting rocky beach and surfing point  with great scenery on a rugged coastline. The park and amenities are well set up and this is a nice part of the coast which is generally very beautiful.

title: Great views
text: Visiting vineyards and stopped to check out town and catch quick lunch. The place is easy to find and the views are amazing. We did need to spend a lot of time.  Surfing not active that day.  One of the many outstanding vistas around the area.

title: A mecca for surfers
text: The community / council has done a really good job developing a wide cement walkway along the foreshore dotted with steel sculptures and information panels adding interest. A true surfer has to at least stop and have a look; nice spot for a walk; plenty of joggers and walkers taking advantage of the pathway.

title: Beautiful
text: Another beautiful beach where the surfers all go. Beautiful sand and the sea very clear with little pools where you can go for a swim .Walked all along the beach to the mouth of the river.Then walked back and sat whatching the sea and the surfers lovely way to pass some time you will feel very chilled following a visit here

title: Easy to lose time
text: I just love this beach for the interesting bay, white sand, exciting ocean and surfing and rugged landscape. A great place to chill on the beach or watch the ocean from the boardwalk and picnic on the grass it even has a bbq. Amazing sunsets too. We stayed until everyone was gone, so relaxing.

title: Beautiful beaches scenery and wild flowers
text:
Went to Surfers Point which is very scenic and obviously a surfers hot spot. The pod of Dolphins we saw too abviously love surfing there too! 
You can spend hours watching the breakers etc and its every changing.
Going in October is Western Australias Spring so the flowers were out and looked amazing

title: So beautiful
text:
Good spot to catch the sunset, as long as there was no cloud cover. 
It’s very windy and chilly too. So make sure you rug up. Parking is very convenient
I am certain it would make an excellent picnic spot, again as long as you rug up and keep warm 
One could watch waves coming in for hours

title: Views
text: This is a great spot to see some awesome waves and maybe catch a hardy surfer or two trying their luck.

title: Great vantage spot to watch the surf
text:
We went there mid afternoon and a reasonable wave was breaking. Some skilled surfers were out putting on a show. 
The car park and viewing area is well maintained and there were were some reasonably detailed displays providing some information on the history and  surfing locations. I’d like to see these better maintained as they getting s little rust stained but overall I got a good impression of an iconic Australian surfing location.

title: Lovely views
text: We always drive out here to watch the surfers. This particular afternoon the surf was not great but the view from the car park was wonderful, with the beautiful blue sky reflected in the water. The car park is well maintained and nicely landscaped, with board walks protecting the dunes.

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Gorgeous beach. Full of families, surfers & couples. Would definitely recommend a visit to the area. Amazing scenery

title: Beatiful Scenery @ Surfers Point
text: Very beautiful scenery at Surfers Point.  Stunning coastline with huge waves.  Stood there for a long while to just starring at the sea and the skyline.  I enjoyed every minutes there.

title: Spectacular beach, giant waves, surfing culture
text: Surfers Point is a highlight of the Margaret River region. The coastline is magnificent. Amazing to watch the huge waves (often over 6 metres high), rolling across the sea from South Africa to this point. And mesmerising to gape at the surfers catching those huge waves. Enjoyed the 10 min walk along the path from the main car park to the point where Margaret River empties into the sea. Boardwalks and lookouts in both places. Beautiful sunset- watched with plenty of local surfers commenting on the skill of those still out there catching the last waves of the day!

title: Amazing
text: Great views. Watched a few surfers for about an hour mid to late afternoon. Drove a few minutes to the mouth of Margaret River. Also amazing. Go at sunset.

title: Wild seas and mad surfers
text: Exciting views of surfers sweeping in on huge waves.  this serious surfing country with names of completion winners on plaques along the pathways. Fascinating to watch the action and a great place for a stroll. Worth the detour.

title: Great place to unwind and relax
text: Awesome place to see sunset and just relax. It isnt too crowded. The beach is also nice and calm on most days. Surely visit if you are in margaret river region!

title: Road trip with girlfriends
text: A great day out from our Dragonfly Escape Air BnB at Bramley we travelled by car to see the cute town of Cowaramup, then a 3.5k walk from Naturaliste to Sugarloaf bay, next Surfers Point and finally Boranup Forest.

title: Good stop
text: What a fun place to stop to watch the waves and surfers.  You can get out and walk the paths or watch the surfers and or/kite surfers.   Beautiful!

title: Windy !
text: Great at sunset!  Very windy so take a jacket. Awesome coastal views and fun to watch the wind surfers!

title: Parachute surfers
text:
We had a good time admiring the skills of the parachute surfers. Strong wind and blinding sun.

We also saw one surfer gearing up, and another gearing down. It was very interesting for us.

A pair of binoculars is useful.

title: One of Australia’s iconic surf beaches
text: This is a must see if you are in Margaret River. Generations of surfers have honed their skills here. And the scenery is beautiful. Just walking on the river mouth beach and watching the kite surfers as the sun sets is fantastic

title: Beautiful spot to watch sunset
text: Surfer's Point is worth a visit. It has great views of the ocean and it's a good place to watch the surfers tackle the huge waves. The carpark is a good size and it's was busy when we were there.  There's good access to the beach below with modern stairs and a seated/viewing area is also provided. It's great for photographs. Will return.

title: Spectacular sunsets, with informative walking trails of indigenous culture and beliefs
text:
My photos really do not do justice to the magnificience of this landscape and sunset. You should go and enjoy the experience for yourself. 

It being September, I'd advice you to wrap up warmly because when the cold wind blows ...  we did enjoy a bracing stroll along the boardwalk though.  There were lots of murals to surfers past, super educational plaques about the natives six seasons, sculptures and poems etc.  I thought it was very well setup. 

Another reviewer here said s/he found this place spiritual, and I concur.

title: Beautiful beach
text: All I can say is wow went for a drive here and the surf was amazing (I don’t surf) would recommend any traveller to take the trip even though it was raining I still got some great pics

title: Great lookout and picnic spot
text: Great spot ro checkout the coastline, the surf and a grassed area for having a picnic.  During Summer months most nights there is a food truck.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Just spectacular. Great pathes for walking the dogs. Clean facilities and well maintained decking. Spectacular for sunsets

title: Unbelievable views
text: Visited here for the surfing championship in April but this was cancelled due to reported Shark attacks a couple of days before. ( beached whales). The views and area are fantastic and need to be seen if visiting Margaret's River W.A. Fantastic time spent here and my wife and I will definitely return.

title: Impressive views
text: Lovely to watch the surfers & kite surfers working hard below us, we had the vantage point on the newly restored boardwalk / headland & could sea for miles.  As with everywhere along this stretch of coast, it's breezy but that adds to awesome nature of the place

title: Best lookout to watch the surfers
text: Drive up the hill to the top of the road and park up, it's the best spot to stand and watch some fantastic surfers do their thing. Amazing view of the whole coast and it also has access down to the beach.

title: Great Scenery
text: I'm too old to be a surfer but I can recognise the attraction of this location and enjoy watching the surfers and kite boarders. The beach area has been totally renewed since our last visit, and there is little evidence of the destruction wrought by the bushfires.  It is regarded as the number one surfing location in Margaret River, the waves are great, easily accessible and reliable. Large carparks and tiered grassy areas make this a wonderful place to visit and view the scenery, the waves and the dunes curving around the sandy beach area. Great facilities to enjoy and then a short stroll or drive to the Rivermouth.

title: cool view
text: It was December, too cold to dive in. However, the view from the cliff was spectacular. I'd like to visit here again when it's hot.

title: Fantastic
text:
This is a really well set up viewing spot.  It would be heaven out you were a surfer. 

I would recommend a stroll on the boardwalk and some time watching the surfers. Not sure it would be good for a swim!

Plenty of parking.

title: Beautiful view
text: Similar to the Great Ocean Road in Melbourne, Surfers Point in Margaret River Perth has a beautiful view, blue skies and golden beaches, littered with small pockets of surfers along the beach.

title: Spiritual place
text: I went at dusk/sunset and was struck by the electric energy of the beach, it felt like a special place where spirits come home.  Surfers Point is a world class break (surf comps are held here) and there are gobsmacking views out to the water over the cliffs with boardwalks and plenty of great vantage points. Surfers Point is at the Northern the end of Gnarabup Beach and if you follow the road along a short way south you come to an old jetty with a pleasant coastal walking track right beside beachside cafe (White Elephant cafe) well worth a look. Surfers Point was a wonderful surprise and I recommend you come here, listen to the waves at dusk and let the seabreeze feed your soul. And to think people only come to Margaret River for the wineries!?

title: Great views
text: This place is great to visit. Many go for the sunset, but if you are lucky in the day time you will also see kite surfing and sail boards out. You can also go a little further to swim at a nice beach or in the Margaret river.

title: Super to watch surfers etc
text: A wide beach with currents which are good for surfers.  Grassed area to sit & watch the sunset.  Seats at top of wooden steps, useful for picnic lunch.

title: Stunning views and sunset!
text: Amazing vistas of the sea, surf and beach. Drive along the road, park the car. Have a picnic and watch the sunset. Wind can be chilly, so wear a jacket, even in summer.

title: Nice views and access to the beach
text: Probably the most famous place for surfers or beach lovers. A must see. Magnificent views, you can walk around, barbecues, toilets and showers.

title: Great spot
text: The local council have put in some great roads amenities and parking facilities.   Not enough parking at the Margaret River entrance car park though on a weekend.

title: First Time Travellers To WA
text: Can get windy but excellent views & sunsets.  Good for a romantic wine, cheese & bikkies - others enjoyed the fish.

title: Amazing view
text: After the cave and wineries, Surfer point and River Mouth is perfect ending to a great day. The weather is rough so the swell was big and very cold. However it is very scenic. Amazing place

title: Great End to the Day
text: If you want to wind down and watch a famous West Australian sunset come here with some snacks and local wine and enjoy surfers point. Ive travelled the globe and this place is one of my faves

title: Just Brilliant
text:
This is a must visit when you are touring around the Margaret River Area. What awesome views over the coastline and when we were there the ocean swell was rolling in the we were lucky enough to watch some very skilful kite surfers. I had a fabulous time photographing these guys while they were having a ball.
Surfers Point is really nicely set up with great amenities, huge parking area, nice information boards highlighting surfing history of the point.
Definitely worth a visit if you are a surfer or not.

title: Amazing view - do not miss this!
text:
Drive down to Surfers Point. There is a big car park, toilet facilities and a BBQ. You get a beautiful view of the waves rolling in, surfers if you are lucky and can see all the way down the coast.

A perfect place to sit and watch the sun set (it is elevated).

title: Awesome view
text: The place was just awesome to sit back and enjoy the sunset. There was nice grass patches to sit back... Pathways to walk along to enjoy the breeze and waves and always in amaze how the surfers can surf in such cold windy weather! Beautiful place to visit!

title: Great views
text:
This is a great location to watch the sea and surfers or even have a picnic. The beaches are good and there are some good walks. the parking can ge busy at the end of the day as people come to watch  the sunset.
Theere is a mobile fish and chip food truck so you can get food and watch the sunset if you haven't got a picnic.
Great spot to spend the end of the day.

title: Surfers Paradise
text: Good for surfing fishing swimming toilets handy.Great sea views of the sea crashing over the rocks and sunbathing.

title: Amazing surf comp
text: The views to watch the surfers was amazing. The extra lengths they went to for the surf competition was great. Seating and food and beverage.

title: Awesome picnic spot by the beach
text:
We arrived after an event so it was calm and less crowded. 
It was a scenic drive going to the location. We passed by a few vineyards and specialty local stores and when we finally arrived, there were enough parking spots nearby, saving us from walking too long under the scorching mid-day sun.
We set up our small sun shade tent on a quiet spot by the shore and had a little picnic. 
We watched the giant waves and had the best view of talented surfers. 
There were a few birds around but not enough to disturb our relaxing picnic lunch. 
We'll definitely come back for the sunset experience people rave about on Surfer's Point!

title: The perfect location for amazing sunsets ...
text:
A stunning place to watch the sunset - best on an evening when there are a few clouds - with a relaxed vibe as people gather on the area overlooking the beach. Don't miss the statue of the surfer at the entrance to the car park.

Easily walked from Prevelly and only a short distance by car from the town of Margaret River. However, for those with mobility issues, there are quite a few steps down to the beach itself, though there are some relatively sheltered benches where you can sit on the way.

I am not a surfer but I love the atmosphere!

title: Amazing
text: Visited this location when the sea was high. We don't surf but it was wonderful to visit and view the amazing surf.

title: An iconic surfing area for the experienced surfer
text: This point has become quite famous for the large waves that build up off the point. The local council has developed the area with lookouts, paths, toilets, carparks and landscaping. The beach is accessible but has sharp limestone rocks.

title: Amazing location
text: This must be one of the most beautiful beaches in Australia. We enjoyed every bit of our visit. A must when you come to Margaret River.

title: My kind of lifestyle!
text:
Best place in Western Australia to view lots of water activities, all happening at once. Wind surfing, kite surfing and body surfing. 

Pack a picnic basket, grab a blanket and settle down whilst enjoying some local wine and taking in the spectacular diversity of this absolutely fantastic little spot.  

Wonderfull welcoming vibe! Oh!! and don't forget to mingle with the locals, they have lots to tell.

title: Magnificent ocean, sunset and surfer point
text: Surfers Point is the best place to gaze at the ocean whilst watching the surfers catch a wave. Its a great spot to view the sunset, enjoying a wine or beer and settling down your afternoon. Though make sure to come early, as parking can get filled up really quickly. Its the ideal place to meet the locals.

title: THE POINT!!!!!!!
text:
If you're an ocean-loving-wave-hunting-wind-inspired appreciator of Mother Nature in all her majesty, then Surfer's Point is a must for any visitor to the South West.  

A sublimely crafted carpark atop one of Australia's most famous surf breaks, Surfer's Point is a viewing platform from which to absorb 365 different takes on where the Southern Ocean, Indian Ocean and SW corner of Australia collide.  

The panorama, north, south and west, is unprecedented.  The ocean state, always varied and inspiring.  The fact that you can park up here, at no cost, sit out on the lawn and chill and watch world class surfing, windsurfing, kitesurfing and just plain spectacular natural scenery, makes Surfers Point a magnet for all the great energy in this world.  

I'm sure there must be a ley line running through that place. 

Also, the public toilets.  I don't normally comment on such things, but the Surfer's Point public toilets would have to be a contender for the world's most environmentally sensitive designed dunnies.  Someone buy the architect for those ablutions a beer please.  Bravo.

Anyways, as you can see, Surfer's Point. . . . IMO. . . is the place to check out.

title: Great place - even for non-surfers
text:
We came here when searching out a coffee legend, but went away thrilled with what we saw. Neither of us have ever surfed, but it was intriguing to watch - and the beauty of the sea & beaches was quite mesmerising. It was also great to see that good money has been well invested in the layout and facilities in the area, enhancing the natural beauty.
Well worth a visit by all travellers.

title: Great view
text:
My partner and I wanted to see the beaches of Margaret river the view did not disappoint. 
An awesome place for a surfing 
Worth the drive for the view

title: Sunsets, Surf, Food Trucks.  A must visit on a balmy summer evening.
text:
I just love this spot.  Most summer evenings there is at least one food truck so grab a picnic blanket, a bottle of rose and a 6 pack of Colonial Draft (all can be bought from the Prevelly general store, they'll give you a couple of plastic cups for wine if you need it) and head up there to watch the sun go down.  

Take a warm top with you as it can get chilly or windy in the evenings.

title: Perfect spot to watch the sunset
text: Came down the Surfers Point on a warm summers day. Sand and sea were lovely conditions and enjoyed a swim. Also a great spot to watch surfers catch some waves. We decided to stay back and watch the sunset - as did many others! We parked ourselves up on the grassy hill, with a rug and some snacks until the sunset. Beautiful spot to do so as you get a full view of a horizon - Surfers points is not too far from the centre of town and is definitely worth a visit!

title: Beatiful beach
text: Very dangerous if not a good swimmer. Go around end towards river mouth wgere it is flatter to get away from possible rips. Lovely pristine waters. Some parts very steep so that part not the best for kids. Can drive around further thru the town to what appears a safer beach

title: Best Holiday ever
text:
We stayed in Surfers Point, Margaret River, and all I can say is it was one of the best holidays we have ever had! We arrived and we were delighted to see a modern, beautiful holiday home overlooking an amazing view of a beach. We had 2 houses as there were 12 of us and it worked perfectly! We had a coffee machine with unlimited free coffee pods and a pool right across from our accomodation. We had beaches galore and there was never a dull moment. The kitchen had all the appliances you would need and they were all clean! The bedrooms all had a spa and an on-suite. The fold out bed was very comfortable and perfect for sharing. There was a Tv in every room and the sitting room Tv had YouTube and Netflix! Great for night time entertainment. It was great for a big family! There was also a balcony in every house! This house is worth every penny we spent and...
We DEFINITELY recommend you to stay in it!!!!

title: Awesome place from just about every viewpoint
text:
Of all the places i have been to surf in the world this has to be in the top 3 !!
The way it has been looked after and built as a road approach, walkways, car park, facilities, beach, rivermouth, scenery is just fantastic with lots of information, lovely sculptures, plaques etc.
I would just ask that everyone that goes respects the flora, grass and work put into it by also not abusing it or littering - keep it so for everyone !!

title: Breathtaking view
text:
When we were there, the sky was very grey, but the view was still pretty spectacular.

There were many lovely rockpools and a great boardwalk above the beach to make the most of the views. 

Looks like a pretty weird place to surf – get thrown the wrong way and you’d end up straight in a bunch of rocks. 

Lots of very interesting interpretive boards with information about the local surfing history as well as the Aboriginal heritage of the area.

There were heaps of wildflowers around, even at the end of the season.

title: Check it out
text: This is a surfers Mecca which means - many surfers there to watch (surfing and preparing to surf and wrapping up) and incredible breaking waves. A great lookout spot - easy parking, steps down to the beach, dog friendly, clean bathrooms.. But, most of all, tranquil ocean beauty.. Stop by and enjoy it for a few... You won't be sorry!

title: Great spot
text: Great little spot if you're learning to surf as its right near the rivermouth and its sort of enclosed by rocks. Not saying theres no breaks there because there is. There are also toilets and showers and teeny tiny car spaces and they fill up quick! Up the road a bit is a great lookout. Ok for dogs too.

title: Surf Views on Steroids
text: Some people may think that the Margaret River region is all about wine tasting and chilling out. But you have to make the journey to Surfers Point.  Even if you've never strapped on a legrope, paddled out into the lineup,  or botched a late take off and gone over the falls,  you'll appreciate the beautiful scenery,  the well set out park and the buzz in the air as surfers head out and return from Mainbreak. If you have a surfing history,  like me,  then it will also be a spiritual experience,  even if you couldn't fit a board in your carry-on luggage.

title: Another Beautiful Sunset
text:
I am retired and looking to find as many beautiful sunsets as I can. This one is a new addition to the top of my list. 

Getting to this location is easy. The countryside is beautiful. The roads are paved and well taken care of right up to the parking lot. There are clean public restrooms on hand. There were a number of people there watching with us. I am told it is always busy.

Pokemon Go characters everywhere along with a couple of stops. 

The sea was wonderful for my eyes, my ears, and my emotions. It was cold as the dickens, but, the second evening we were better prepared. 

I recommend this location. You have the option to view the sunset from your car with an unobstructed view, but, of course, I recommend braving the cold [or heat, I am sure it gets hot as hell here in summer] to see this sunset from the grassy area. Oh, you can take the sturdy stairs down to the beach, but, I was too tired from the days touring.

title: great views
text: Haven't been there for donkeys years and was very impressed with the way it has been set out with balconies, steps and paths. Awesome spot for a photo op.

title: Excellent to watch the sunset
text:
It's a short drive from Margaret River town, approximately 8km. A must visit for the sunset.
There is ample parking at Surfers point, and as the name suggests it's for the Surf buffs.
Quite a few wind and kite surfers were out that day. Winds were amazing.
Plenty of small groups were there, most had their dogs with them. Very happy environment.

Would be a shame to miss this.

title: Fantastic sun set
text:
It's very windy and we got the choice to get down our car to snap some photos. And then we literally sit in our car, and appreciate the sun setting down. 

We were here at 6.10pm, 30 mins before the sun set.

title: Dramatic Windy beautiful beach
text:
We were there for the sunset at 6, the setting was dramatic and scenery beautiful. Stairs/steps lead down to the beach and You can see wooden Long chair dedicated to those who lost their life's to their last wave. 

There's plenty history and information, on well designed signalés. You can read that the Macaulay family having won many of the surf completion. Starting with Mike, Dave and current women's winner Laura.  

Ample safe parking with lawns for sitting down to watch surfs and surfers.  Safe for Swimming too.

title: fabulous coast line
text: Boy what fabulous views of the coast with an occasional whale. If you drive a little further north you can see the mouth of the Margaret river. Great place for a dip. The boardies loved the area as the waves were large.

title: Worth a stop even just for viewing
text: Had never been to Prevelly despite multiple trips per year to the region.  Stopped in at the top of Surfers point and it was lovely.  Even though it was a windy rainy day I wish I had spent more time just enjoying the view but had to duck back to the car due to the cold.  I was there in the early morning when hardly anyone was about, best time to go.  There was a coffee van setting up as I left, a hot chocolate might have helped for me to stay longer!

title: lot of money spent on this
text: as what is actually just a car park, then this car park is something special.  It's been designed as a viewing point of all the surfers out there in a the sea.  A great place to sit, relax and watch.

title: spectacular spot
text: Beautiful views of the ocean and fantastic board walks, an amazing and spectacular place to be. Great for the whole family not just the beach goers.

title: WOW stunning views
text: This was the final stop on our road trip to Margaret River and it was such a beautiful sight. We arrived in the late afternoon and the sun was setting.. It really was stunning, took my breath away!

title: Awesome views during winter of the waves
text: Beautiful picture card view.There were a few surfers and the waves were strong and it was just awesome. The blue waters, white waves and sandy golden beaches make you feel at awe of this great surfing region.

title: Strong swells and waves
text: Site of surfing competition - very strong waves and swells. We were there to enjoy the view and sunshine. Water only for skilled swimmers and surfers. Quick drive from Margaret River town.

title: Great place to soak in the strong breeze
text: It's only on our second visit to Margaret River did it sink in that there was a world class surfing beach here. It has a really beautiful landscape and white surf. But there's something about beaches that magnetise and relax you . Must visit if you are here

title: Nice views during winter
text: Strong waves. The view is amazing. Very windy. Hardly anyone surf during winter (spotted 1) as the waves are super strong.

title: Best Surf viewing location in south west
text: the elevated position here at the car park gives you the best position you could imagine for watching the surfers in one of the best breaks around.

title: Could sit here all day
text: An amazing bit of coast. You could sit there all day sunshine or rain. nice grassed areas to watch surfers out in the water. bit of history to read also.

title: Margaret River Pro 2016
text:
Now that the Margaret River Pro has been awarded World Championship Tour status, its long-held reputation as a surfing mecca has been confirmed. The event sees 32 of the top men and 18 of the top women surfers hitting some of the best surfing conditions in the world on one of the most beautiful parts of the Australian coastline. 

We come here every year to meet and watch all the world champ surfers.  Great event and amazing spot.  I am not a surfer but love this spot.  It is absolutely beautiful.  Even if you are just in Yallingup, Dunsborough or Margaret River it is absolutely worth coming down here!!

title: Super seaside
text: Plate for championship surfing. If you are not good enough to surf then it is great fun watching. Lovely coastal views. Houses hidden in the flora. Stunning.

title: Well worth a visit if down that way
text: Magnificent views and walking paths with plenty to see. Prevelly is a nice place to stay for a few days rather than in Margaret River itself. When the surf is up it can get quite busy but normally this area is very quiet and serene.

title: Surfers paradise!
text: Spectacular!  I could sit here all day and watch the surfers.  The view is stunning, the water clear and clean.  The stairs to the beach are well maintained and so are the facilities in the area.  Makes me want to go and get my surf back on!

title: Favourite place on the coast in Prevelly
text:
This is an amazing place to visit, especially if the waves are big, and there are people out on the water.  Fantastic viewpoint for watching surfers, and if the wind comes up, there will be a lot of windsurfers and kitesurfers as well.  The folks who hit the water here are usually very experienced, so you'll see some high class manoeuvres, spins, and flips happening.  Very fun and amazing to watch. There are great views, but you may want to take some binoculars to get even closer to the action.  

It's also a lovely place to watch the sunset.  There's a lovely grassed area, and it's very popular place for people to chill out and relax as the day draws to a close.

Facilities here include a massive parking area, good toilets, and a gas BBQ (under a shelter).

There are stairs going down to the beach, and it's a fun place to explore and look around.  I'd recommend doing the short walk along the beach to the river mouth - you'll see reef, rock pools, and more.

You can also take a short walk from here on a paved path to the nearby River Mouth.  

The main break here at Surfers Point helped make Margaret River famous, so it's definitely a must visit if you're in the area.

title: Beautiful, clear waters
text: Our Airbnb place was just a couple of steps away, the view was memorizing - very windy as well and will definitely return when I come by Marg River again.

title: Watch the surfers
text:
If conditions are right this is a spot to watch the surfers.

It also works for sunset and on wilder days is quite elemental and exposed. In any event, Prevelly has a wild weather beaten feel to it.

There are newish boardwalks, picnic areas and BBQs etc, and steps down to beaches with interesting rock pools etc.

title: Amazing place to watch the surf and sunset
text: You could sit here for hours watching the waves roll in and then the sun set. it does get quite windy up there. But its a very beautiful spot and the locals seem to be very friendly and keen for a chat if approached. There is wild rosemary that grows all around the hills which you can smell in the wind. Even if you don't surf, I recommend checking this place out.

title: Beautiful
text: A wonderful place to watch the sun set , its so beautiful. Windy too with good waves for surfing and kite surfing !

title: Stunning Place, Stunning Architecture
text: What a great example of public architecture. Well done Chris and David! You have transformed a surf magnet into an international venue.

title: Gorgeous
text: Perfect spot to have a sundowner. Sit back and watch the kitesurfers or nip round the corner and catch the groms

title: Beautiful
text: A beautiful place to see the sunset/rise and watch the surfers adn wind surfers. There nice little features and view points about the place.

title: Wow!
text:
Beautiful sunsets! Can get quiet packed up there because of it! Everyone love to bring dinner & or wine down there, watch the surfers, kitesurfers & windsurfers. 

Great toilet facilities day & night! 

The only thing that dissapointed me was when the car park was near full a car parked in the walk way area & another had parked in the disabled car park next to it with no acrod sticker. If they had waited 5 more seconds or looked with they're eyes there we spots available/ becoming available. 

Once again praising Josh&Sarah palmalteers surf school near the rivermouth, Awesome people, lots of knowlege & recommended to all ages & stages! 

Love it! Hope to visit soon!

title: Panoramic
text: If you're into surfing, taking photo's, going for a walk along the beach, this is definitely the spot to do it when you go down south.

title: Magical
text:
Whether you surf or not, this place is magical, and definitely worth a visit. I was mesmerised by the surf riders on the waves. We went back twice just to sit and watch . Stunning views. Nice area to sit on lawn if you wish and steps down to the beach. 
As it was winter we were happy to sit in the car, after picking up coffe from the combined van at the bottom of the hill, and watching the amazing waves and riders.

title: We will miss this place
text: We made our X-Mas Break at Margaret River. We rented a lovely Beach House at Prevelly. We loved to go to this place to watch the surfers fighting against the big waves crushing. Some days we shared the Beach with Seals. It is one of these places on earth I will always think back with a smile on my face....

title: Sunset over the ocean
text: Went to Surfers Point to see the largest waves in 10 years and the surf was impressive. The whole area has been landscaped with boardwalks, viewing platforms and information boards. The best part was sitting above the beach, having a drink and watching the sun set over the ocean....one of those chilled moments in life.

title: Surf at it's best
text: Some of the biggest wave I have seen, plenty taking advantage of the big surf. 20 degrees in June, absolutely glorious day.

title: Beautiful Sunset
text: Prevelly beach is a must see. It was great watching numerous surfers surfing the real high waves! The sunset was absolutely beautiful amidst the roaring waves. It was a wonderful experience.

title: Excellent surfing beach
text: We visited the Prevelly and stated for a few days on our way to Margaret River and was a pleasant stop off point. Craven park and beach are fantastic!

title: watching surfers and one man and his dog in grass area
text: to watch surfing in the horseshoe bay was amazing.the sunsets were breath taking.the sculpture on the grass behind the bay was great,a whole new meaning to one man and his dog.a holiday to remember.

title: Great views of kite surfers
text: Beautiful location, quite windy but well worth the spectacle of surfers including kite. Lovely spot to watch sunsets too

title: Neat place to sit and view surfers
text: We visited this place a couple of times as it had a great view with plenty of action. Plenty of seating to sit and watch the surfers or even go for a swim.

title: sunset kangaroo safari
text: Our family had a great time, in the back of the Bedford truck hunting for roo's, Neil was a great host and had loads of stories to tell and our kids had a ball feeding the beautiful horses and the Billy tea and orange cake where delicious, hope to visit the farm stay when your all set up ?

title: Relaxed NYE at Surfers Point
text: Nowhere is more suited to soaking in the ambiance of the Margaret River area then lazy upon the grassy banks at Surfers Point with some local cheese and fresh produce with numerous other like minded people. This area is great for families, couples, locals or visitors to the area and allows you to take in the spectacular sight of the waves on display right in front of you or to enjoy the abundance of warm afternoon sunlight coupled with copious amounts of fresh air. Perking is more than ample and there is a definite relaxed vibe where people from all walks of life can mingle and enjoy nature at its best. A definite way to ease into New Years Eve before hitting Settlers Tavern or the MR Hotel or one of the numerous quality eateries that line the main street.

title: Sunset
text: I stayed in Margaret River since 2 months. Surfers point in Prevelly is absolutely my favourite place here around. There's always someone who enjoy the landscape or preparing to surf or take some picture. In particular at the sunset is amazing.

title: Great Views, Big Waves
text:
We had a quick stop here with not enough time to really explore the area. The views were great and the name lived up to expectations with large surfing waves crashing. 

The road from the carpark goes on to where the river meets the sea. Great swimming spot for kids too in the river. 

There is also a great view of the river and the ocean from a high vantage point on the way back towards caves road. There is a small stop off area on the side of the road for this.

title: Bautiful
text: Great spot for a picnic or just to watch the sunset. Grab some wine/beer, takeaway and enjoy :) Definitely worth a visit if you're in Margaret River as it is a short drive away.

title: Awesome
text: Surfers point on prevelly beach was great. There was a lot of parking and easy access to the beach down the stairs. There were picnic areas and many tiers to watch the surfers and kite surfers. Close to the beach is pretty shallow and good for swimming. Farther out looked like there were plenty of waves. And the views were wonderful as well.

title: Upgrades have made great changes to one of the most popular surf beaches in the South West
text: We were last here 2 years ago and the changes are great. We now have changing rooms and a beautiful boardwalk to enjoy a picnic dinner watching sun go down. Though the night we were there a windy, we wrapped up together making it a little more romantic. Great work by the local shire and staff.

title: Place to see so many kangaroos
text: This is a place where we can see so many kangaroos jumping and playing with their family. This is along the drive so a must see place by stopping in between drive.

title: Beautiful area, a favourite of ours
text: This area is just beautiful, a lot of work and money has been put into the area along the coastline, lovely park, walks and of course stunning scenery.  We were staying in Gracetown but went to Prevelly every day for a walk through this lovely area.

title: River meets ocean
text: This is where the Margaret River meets the ocean. It's got huge surfers waves on the beach and in the inside it's quiet and peaceful with people kayaking and trekking

title: Great view and great spot for lunch
text: Definitely recommend a stop to Prevelly Park for anybody in the Margaret River area. Nice lunch spot and easy hiking along the Cape to Cape Trail. Amazing views of the ocean.

title: Great view
text: A superb place where the river meets the sea. With newly made decks which are wheelchair friendly we had a pleasant time watching the sunset.

title: Surfs Up !
text: Lovely spot, amazing views and the water looked very inviting .. a few surfers sunbathing when we visited but the waves looked good !

title: Rivermouth Point- excellent place
text: The end point of Rivermouth road is a place where the ocean and the river meet. It is a nice place beside the surfer point. You may swimming in the shallow river water.

title: Arty Park
text: LOVED the arty mural and sculptures! We took photos and felt inspired, as adults, but also enjoyed watching kids ride their bikes and scooters around.

title: Spectacular and well thought out
text:
We discovered Surfers Point by accident. We dropped in at sunset after a day of sightseeing, and discovered that it's a meeting point for locals at that time. The very ample car park had about 50 vehicles in it in the middle of winter. This was more cars than we'd seen since leaving Sydney.

The headland has been superbly landscaped with steel, rock and wood and has an extraordinary architect-designed facility for public loos, build into the rock. The ambience, view and design of the whole area are exceptional. I'd imagine watching surfing contest here would be incredible. Top marks from me.

title: If you mean Surfers Point - spectacular
text: We visited Surfers Point at sunset, not knowing it is a local ritual. A very beautiful natural location enhanced with thoughtful and stylish facilities - a tribute to the stunning natural environment. We also walked from the river mouth to Gnarabup via Surfers Point by day which was wild.

title: Dont Miss This
text: What a beautiful place to see ...the Greek Orthodox Church with it's amazing history and  what a view of the Indian Ocean !

title: What amazing views...
text: Loved it here. Bought a takeaway coffee from Dome in Margaret River and earlier in the day we bought delicious Italian made biscuits from the market and we brought the coffee and biscuits to Prevelly park and enjoyed the sun set .. the weather was pretty bad at the time which made the views even more spectacular! Spent an hour here!

title: Excellent view and weather
text: We liked it very much... The place is awesome. We were there in the afternoon and enjoyed the sunset over there. There is a park where children can play and you just seat to take tea/ coffee with you.

title: MR Pro
text: Very busy but extremely clean and tidy. well done MR on a very well run 2014 Surf Pro. great range of healthy foods.

title: great rugged natural beauty
text: rugged beauty and great beaches. coffee shop onsite sells great coffee. we visited on a wild and stormy day but the beauty of the place was still there

title: Great Place to watch the surfers
text: I watched large waves bringing in the surfers at Surfers Point for ages. The colour of the sea, a mix of bright turquoises and dark blues, makes it a very pretty destination to spend a few hours standing and staring or wandering the paths.

title: Superb area of the coastline
text: Such a beautiful are. Beaches and cafés very clean. Spectacular views of the Indian Ocean.  Parking free and available.

title: Great coastline
text:
My daughter and I had a great time at the beach, one of the more popular beaches nearer to Margret river. 

A must do...snorkel to the nearest atoll and see school of fishes....wave are pretty strong but still OK for young children to run up and down from sand to water.

No food or water point, do remember to bring your picnic basket and heaps of sunblock!

title: Amazing Coastline
text:
Spectacular coastline between the Margaret River mouth and the White Elephant Cafe (great breakfast).  Includes secluded coves and a heavy reef break that attracts surf addicts from along the coast when it works.

Easy access, perhaps two-minutes west of Caves Road and top spot to photograph late afternoon and into sunset!!
